Articles.Content:
so i was playing ksp .23.5 a few days ago and i managed to kill Jeb, I was playing with mods deadly reentry being one of them and i feel back into kerbins atmosphere way to steeply and his rocket burnt up.

my question to you is how have you killed Jeb?
Every way possible, however it seems he some how is resurrected and sneaks into my next mission...

Every way possible, however it seems he some how is resurrected and sneaks into my next mission...

with the one i mentioned i killed him for good
That's what you think...

That's what you think...

Yeah, for sure. Jeb's like the Terminator, "I'll be back!"

how have you killed Jeb?

I haven't.

I have killed him in my Ironman Mode career save, through evaing from the mk1 pod. Thinking he will hold. It didnt

He hit the ground and then died
On many uneventful missions... Kerbal re-entry... all going well.. hey, where are the chutes?
Ironmanning in 0.24 - a very dangerous, untested, low tech 5 man Duna ship failed at about 2300m, killing all 5 astronauts instantly, including Jeb and Bill.

"Not."

I have not killed Jeb. Not since at least three versions ago.
I killed Jeb recently on Minmus. It was early tech and no batteries, lost control and he died. Most of the time I keep him alive, this was a fluke.

My Jeb has never died. It's insane, he's had the most incredible streaks of luck. Rockets explode, but the capsule survives. Spaceplanes crash, but the cockpit survies. Landings on Eve, Moho, Tylo, Laythe... he returns safely every time. He's never even been stranded somewhere.

Part of it is that I'm now much better at designing ships that do what they're supposed to, and I've got a whole network of unmanned fuel depots (so he doesn't get stranded anywhere) but it's still an improbable streak. Bill and Bob have died, as well as a few others, but Jeb just keeps on truckin'.

Jeb? Never heard of him...

Oh wait, you mean the janitor named Jeb in the VAB?

Last time he died and came from the dead was in 0.13.3. so I recruited him and his friends Bill and Bob to clean all the fuel leaks I have everyday.

After he was the first kerbal in space, I didnt want to let him go anymore (because he is a valuable propaganda asset).

When he managed to sneak on the first mission to leave Kerbin SoI, I put him in a command pod, together with Bob and the other one (first Kerbals on Minmus and Mun). Lots of life support (TAC) and Batteries and parked him outside KSC as a tourist attraction...

Kept him from sneaking on missions...
I EVA'd after landing back on Kerbin to grab a surface sample. I forgot I had physics warp 4x on. He fell on the ground and exploded..... At least he died at home...

I EVA'd after landing back on Kerbin to grab a surface sample. I forgot I had physics warp 4x on. He fell on the ground and exploded..... At least he died at home...

"sigh" the kraken takes another victim...

I never killed Jeb. True - he stepped out of his capsule in flight, and was swept away by the wind. But the fall from over 300 meters did not kill him - Jeb pulled a Houdini, disappearing in a puff of smoke. He will be back in KSC in no time
Okay all you "Saints"!,,, I'll step up and admit it. I've killed Jeb on many occasions. I might be right around the "50" mark! "Hi everybody, I'm so and so, and I'm a Killajebaholic!"

Just experimented with Ironman Career and I have successfully (by accident) killed Jeb permanently.

Since I like keeping Jeb around, I'm going to start a fresh save. Without him, the space program is doomed lol.

Edit: As a matter fact, why not try a challenge where if you lose Jeb, Bill, or Bob, you must delete your entire save (as your program has failed!).

EVA in low atmosphere in valiant attempt to repack a parachute..

He may not have made it back into the cabin... but BY GOD DID HE REPACK THAT CHUTE! So long Jeb

Better to ask what ways I HAVEN'T killed Jebediah.

The most memorable one was a Hell Kraken strike at Jool.
Playing ironman, Jeb died in a tragic airplane crash due to my piloting error: he crashed into the end-edge of the runway because I misgauged my elevation

I killed Jeb due to recycling-greed in 0.24.

I had this Kerbin-orbit mission with a rocket that proved far larger than required, mainly because it was my first asparagus rocket.

So after jettisoning the asparagus-boosters, I could orbit, de-orbit and make a powered+parachute landing of a quite tall two-stage rocket. Landing went perfect - but then it toppled over before I could finish the mission, and the capsule went boom. Most distressing to loose Jeb, just as the mission appeared to be safely ended.
Killed Jeb? What kind of casual do you take me/him for?
I did kill him once when I was seeing what the RealChute April Fools joke was, but that was only testing/playing about. Otherwise I've never killed any Kerbals ever...
